subject: Philosophy
title: Locke's Memory Theory
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Locke's Memory Theory.

hook.text: John Locke said you are your memories. If you remember doing it, the person who did it was you.

buildup.text: This was revolutionary. Identity isn't about the body or soul â€” it's about psychological continuity.

discovery.text: If your memories were transferred to a new body, you would go with them. The body is just hardware.

twist.text: But memories are unreliable. We forget, confabulate, and invent memories. If identity rests on them, it's fragile.

climax.text: Alzheimer's patients lose their memories. Does that mean they lose their identity? Most people say no.

punchline.text: You are your memories â€” until you forget them.

quiz.question: What determines personal identity according to Locke?
